We need to do more to ensure the safety of passengers, and this legislation is a step in the right direction.

In June 2015, I expressed to leadership in the House of Representatives that PTC technology was needed to avoid any additional Amtrak train crashes.  I requested full funding of $475 million for PTC technology on Amtrak trains.

Last week, the National Transportation Safety Board reported that the accident would have been prevented by the use of Positive Train Control (PTC) technology. I have consistently supported upgrades to our rail infrastructure including full funding for PTC technology.

Today I joined my colleagues in introducing the Positive Train Control Implementation & Financing Act, in response to the December 18, 2017 crash of Amtrak Train 501 in Washington which tragically killed three passengers. https://twitter.com/TransportDems/status/951503117509636096 QT @TransportDems TODAY: Top House Democrats intro'd the Positive Train Control Implementation & Financing Act, in response to the Dec 18, 2017 crash of Amtrak Train 501 in Wash., which killed three passengers.
